result.execSummary:
The defendant John C Krumenacher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Cash bail applied to court costs.  Balance of costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Anger Management or Domestic Violence Counseling if Agent deems appropriate.
No violent contact with the victim listed in the Criminal Complaint.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

records.addlTxt: Letter dated May 9, 2018, received on May 11, 2018, filed by defendant regarding the Court's denial of expungement on this case.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order is denied.  The defendant was not under the age of 25 at the time of the commission of the offense.
records.descr: Order on Pet. to Expunge Court Rec. of Conviction

records.addlTxt:
Letter dated 10/15/17 filed by defendant, requesting expungement.

11/02/17 - Court reviewed and denied defendant's request because defendant is statutorily ineligible, he is over the age limit.

Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Barry Braatz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant John C Krumenacher in court with attorney Kevin Brian Dunn.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 2.
Count 1 is dismissed as a read in.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
75 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
STAYED.
  
Term of Probation:  1 Year.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Anger Management or DV Counseling if agent deems appropriate.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No violent contact with: victim listed in the criminal complaint. 
DNA sample to be provided.

Costs:  $243
DV Surcharge:  $100
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives - Already Provided.
Apply Bail.
Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Hearing on June 9, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant John C Krumenacher in court with attorney Kevin Brian Dunn. 
Defense still waiting on some discovery and an offer from the State.
  Hearing scheduled for June 9, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Hearing at 04-04-2016 10:30 am

Court modifies Cash Bail to $300
CONDITIONS:
Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim/witness listed in the criminal complaint.  
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant John C Krumenacher in court, in custody, with attorney Kevin Brian Dunn.  

Atty. Dunn presented bail reduction arguments to the court.
State takes no position.

Court Grants - Defense request for bail modification.
Court modifies Cash Bail to $300
CONDITIONS:
Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim/witness listed in the criminal complaint.  
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Hearing scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-24-2016 01:45 pm

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant John C Krumenacher in court, in custody, with attorney Kevin Brian Dunn.    
Defense still waiting on Discovery.

Atty. Dunn requests to argue bail and presented arguments.
Atty. Dunn argues for reduction of cash bail.
State objects and presented arguments.

Court Denies - Defense request for bail modification.
Bail and Conditions remain as previously fixed.

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
Hearing at 02-05-2016 09:30 am

Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim/witness listed in the criminal complaint.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant John C Krumenacher in court, in custody.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant was not interviewed by the public defender. Defendant to seek counsel.  Defendant allowed a non collect call/calls.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 09:30 am.
